name: Pharmacy/Treatment Administration
description: The Pharmacy/Treatment Administration segment (RXA) carries pharmacy's or treatment administration information. This segment documents what was actually administered to the patient, including timing, route, dose, and administration details. It is critical for medication administration records (MAR), clinical documentation, and tracking actual patient care delivery.

cardinality.note: RXA provides actual administration details when medications are given

RXA.1.name: Give Sub-ID Counter
RXA.1.description: This field contains the give sub-ID counter which allows for the unique identification of each administration record.
RXA.1.generationHint: Sequential counter starting at 1 for each medication order

RXA.2.name: Administration Sub-ID Counter
RXA.2.description: This field contains the administration sub-ID counter for multiple administrations of the same order.
RXA.2.generationHint: Sequential counter for each administration instance

RXA.3.name: Date/Time Start of Administration
RXA.3.description: This field contains the date and time when administration began.
RXA.3.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, precise to the minute for most medications

RXA.4.name: Date/Time End of Administration
RXA.4.description: This field contains the date and time when administration ended.
RXA.4.generationHint: For push medications, same as start time; for infusions, actual end time

RXA.5.name: Administered Code
RXA.5.description: This field contains the code that identifies what was actually administered.

RXA.6.name: Administered Amount
RXA.6.description: This field contains the amount of medication actually administered.
RXA.6.generationHint: Numeric value representing actual dose given

RXA.7.name: Administered Units
RXA.7.description: This field contains the units of the administered amount.

RXA.8.name: Administered Dosage Form
RXA.8.description: This field contains the dosage form of the medication administered.

RXA.9.name: Administration Notes
RXA.9.description: This field contains notes about the administration that the nurse/provider wants to document.
RXA.9.generationHint: Coded or free text administration notes

RXA.10.name: Administering Provider
RXA.10.description: This field contains the identification of the person who administered the medication.
RXA.10.generationHint: Nurse or provider identifier in XCN format

RXA.11.name: Administered-at Location
RXA.11.description: This field identifies the location where the medication was administered.

RXA.12.name: Administered Per (Time Unit)
RXA.12.description: This field indicates the time unit for administration rate calculations.

RXA.13.name: Administered Strength
RXA.13.description: This field contains the strength of the administered medication.

RXA.14.name: Administered Strength Units
RXA.14.description: This field contains the units for the administered strength.

RXA.15.name: Substance Lot Number
RXA.15.description: This field contains the lot number of the substance administered.

RXA.16.name: Substance Expiration Date
RXA.16.description: This field contains the expiration date of the substance administered.

RXA.17.name: Substance Manufacturer Name
RXA.17.description: This field contains the name of the manufacturer of the administered substance.

RXA.18.name: Substance/Treatment Refusal Reason
RXA.18.description: This field contains the reason why the substance or treatment was refused.
RXA.18.generationHint: Coded reason for refusal or non-administration

RXA.19.name: Indication
RXA.19.description: This field contains the indication for which the medication was administered.

RXA.20.name: Completion Status
RXA.20.description: This field indicates the completion status of the administration.

RXA.21.name: Action Code-RXA
RXA.21.description: This field contains the action code that indicates what action is being taken with this RXA segment.

RXA.22.name: System Entry Date/Time
RXA.22.description: This field contains the date and time the administration was entered into the system.

RXA.23.name: Administered Drug Strength Volume
RXA.23.description: This field contains the volume component of drug strength for liquid medications.
RXA.23.generationHint: Volume amount for liquid strength calculations

RXA.24.name: Administered Drug Strength Volume Units
RXA.24.description: This field contains the units for the drug strength volume.

RXA.25.name: Administered Barcode Identifier
RXA.25.description: This field contains the barcode identifier of the administered medication.

RXA.26.name: Pharmacy Order Type
RXA.26.description: This field indicates the type of pharmacy order being administered.

notes: RXA segments document actual medication administration vs. orders or dispenses
The segment supports both successful administrations and refusals/non-administrations
Timing precision is critical for audit trails and clinical correlation
Barcode verification and witness requirements vary by organization policy
The segment accommodates both unit-dose and calculated dose administrations
Multiple RXA segments may represent complex administration scenarios
Integration with smart pumps and automated systems extends functionality

dataConsistency.timingValidation: RXA.4 must be >= RXA.3 (end after start)
dataConsistency.doseUnits: RXA.6 and RXA.7 must be compatible
dataConsistency.strengthConsistency: RXA.13 and RXA.14 should match medication profile
dataConsistency.completionLogic: RXA.20 must align with dose amounts and refusal reasons

businessRules.controlledSubstances: Enhanced documentation required for schedules II-V
businessRules.barcodeVerification: Safety protocols may mandate barcode scanning
businessRules.timingCompliance: Administration timing must align with order specifications

messageFlow.workflow: Usually follows RXD (dispense) and updates patient care record
